p: Novel infectious diseases resulting from RNA viruses subject to mutation and genetic recombination, as well as cross-species transmission, will continue to present a serious global health threat, as exemplified by COVID-19. Despite two former major outbreaks of coronavirus infections causing the SARS and MERS respiratory illnesses, the world remains underprepared to effectively manage the current COVID-19 outbreak, as evidenced by the fact that COVID-19 has resulted in thousands of deaths worldwide.
